overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a structured approach to time-series forecasting with limited data (96 hourly points). The analyst identifies daily seasonality, checks for missing values and outliers, evaluates multiple modeling approaches (SARIMA, Exponential Smoothing), and ultimately selects a robust heuristic method due to data constraints. The process emphasizes practical adaptation to data limitations and anomaly handling.
common_data_patterns: Complete time index without explicit missing values
Negative daytime values with positive nighttime values
key_insights: Prioritizing robust statistics (median over mean) to handle outliers in small datasets
Acknowledging data limitations (only 4 days) prevents overcomplication with models like SARIMA
Explicitly verifying data completeness before forecasting
Hourly pattern consistency enables simple yet effective forecasting via hourly aggregation
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex: Combines initial consideration of advanced models (SARIMA, Exponential Smoothing) with practical simplification to heuristic methods after data inspection, featuring detailed outlier handling and pattern analysis.
